title: Iconic Fashion Designer Giorgio Armani Dies at 91
snippets: Armani's clothes highlight the body as an object of art. Celebrities have flaunted his fashion on red carpets for decades. He revolutionized the suit jacket, with casual silhouettes and softer colors.
The fashion designer was the archetype of Italian style and elegance, reimagining men's and women's suits.
The celebrated fashion designer leaves an indelible mark on global style and elegance.
The Piacenza native founded the Milan-based luxury fashion company of the same name in 1975. Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni called him a "symbol of the best of Italy."
Armani founded the luxury fashion house that bore his name in 1975 in Milan with his partner Sergio Galeotti.
Founder of world’s largest private luxury brand transformed his industry
He brought refinement to the power suit, transforming contemporary fashion. “He was completely radical,” said designer Paul Smith.

His company announced death of designer synonymous with modern Italian style and elegance on Thursday

Giorgio Armani, the celebrated Italian fashion designer who built a global empire has died, his company said on Thursday. He was 91.

“With infinite sorrow, the Armani Group announces
The billionaire designer died “peacefully, surrounded by his loved ones,” his fashion house said.
titles: Fashion designer Giorgio Armani, whose name became synonymous with luxury, dies at 91
Giorgio Armani, legendary Italian designer, dies aged 91
Italian fashion icon Giorgio Armani passes away at 91
Italian fashion icon Giorgio Armani dies
Giorgio Armani, legendary Italian fashion designer, dies at 91
Giorgio Armani, fashion designer and businessman, 1934-2025
Giorgio Armani, whose streamlined fashions ruled the red carpet, dies at 91
Giorgio Armani, celebrated Italian fashion designer, dies at 91
Billionaire Fashion Designer Giorgio Armani Dead At 91
summary: Giorgio Armani, the iconic Italian fashion designer known for revolutionizing the suit with casual silhouettes and softer colors, has died at the age of 91. His company, founded in Milan in 1975, confirmed his peaceful passing surrounded by loved ones. Armani, celebrated for his contributions to modern Italian style and elegance, transformed global fashion with his designs. Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni hailed him as a symbol of the best of Italy. His legacy includes being the founder of the world's largest privately-owned luxury fashion brand.

title: Lisbon Funicular Derailment Kills 15, Injures 18
snippets: Local media reports suggest a cable came loose along the railway's route, causing it to lose control - a national day of mourning is being observed
Portugal is observing a day of national mourning to commemorate the victims who died on the "Elevador da Gloria" in the capital. An investigation is underway as the death toll has gone up to 16.
The authorities were also working to identify the victims, which a local official said included some foreigners. The funicular is popular with tourists.
At least 16 people were killed after the Glória funicular, one of the city’s most popular tourist attractions, crashed.
A Canadian has been confirmed among the injured following a funicular streetcar crash in Lisbon, Portugal Wednesday, in which at least 17 people died, authorities say.

LISBON, Portugal (AP) —  Investigators sifted through the wreckage of a streetcar in downtown Lisbon on Thursday, trying to determine why the popular tourist attraction derailed during the busy summer season, killing 16 people and injuring 21, five of them seriously. The Elevador
titles: Watch: BBC correspondent at scene of Lisbon funicular crash
Portugal mourns Lisbon funicular crash victims
Portugal Searches for Cause of Lisbon Funicular Crash as Death Toll Rises
Lisbon Funicular Crash: What to Know About Cause and Victims
Lisbon funicular crash: A Canadian is among those hurt, officials say
Canadian among injured as Portuguese investigators search for cause of Lisbon funicular crash that killed 16
summary: A tragic incident occurred in Lisbon when the Glória funicular, a major tourist attraction, derailed and crashed, resulting in at least 15 fatalities and 18 injuries. This event took place on Wednesday.

title: Cam Thomas Accepts Nets' Qualifying Offer, Eyes Free Agency Next Summer
snippets: Restricted free agent Cam Thomas has opted for the qualifying offer with the Nets that gives him a full no-trade clause and sets him for unrestricted free agency next summer with at least 10 teams set to have cap space, sources told ESPN.
Thomas is betting on himself to secure a big deal next offseason when he becomes an unrestricted free agent
The max Brooklyn offered was two years, $30 million, but Thomas thought he deserved far more so bet on himself.
titles: Sources: Nets' Thomas picks $6M qualifying offer
Cam Thomas contract: Restricted free agent signs $6 million qualifying offer with Nets in rare move
Cam Thomas reportedly to sign $6 million qualifying offer with Brooklyn, become free agent next summer
summary: Cam Thomas, a restricted free agent, has accepted a qualifying offer from the Nets, gaining a no-trade clause and paving his way to become an unrestricted free agent next summer. Rejecting Brooklyn's max offer of two years, $30 million, Thomas is aiming for a larger deal, anticipating interest from at least 10 teams with cap space next year.

title: RFK Jr. Faces Criticism from Dems, HHS Staff Over Health Policy Approach
snippets: Democratic lawmakers and more than a thousand current and former HHS staff say Kennedy's actions are endangering America's health. Kennedy says he came to clean house and he's delivering.

RFK Jr. testifies at Senate hearing amid CDC, vaccine upheaval - Axios
LIVE:  RFK Jr. faces grilling over CDC turmoil, vaccines
summary: Democratic lawmakers and over a thousand current and former HHS staff have criticized RFK Jr.'s actions as harmful to public health. RFK Jr., however, contends that his efforts are aimed at reforming the system, stating he is fulfilling his promise to "clean house." This controversy came to light during a Senate hearing, highlighting the deep divide over his approach to health policy and its implications.

title: Lloyds Bank to Warn Bottom 5% of Staff on Performance, Affecting 3,000 Jobs
snippets: Lloyds Banking Group's policy puts 3,000 jobs at risk, with staff to be told they must improve their work or lose their job.
UK bank set to tell weakest 5% of employees their work must improve or they risk dismissal

With economic uncertainty leading fewer people to leave, bank will put one in 20 on ‘performance plans’

  • B
titles: Thousands of Lloyds staff deemed to be underperforming face axe
Thousands of Lloyds staff face axe in performance overhaul
Lloyds to warn 3,000 staff they face sack for ‘underperformance’
summary: Lloyds Banking Group is set to notify the bottom 5% of its employees about the need to improve their work performance or face dismissal. This decision, affecting 3,000 jobs, comes as economic uncertainty has led to fewer voluntary departures, prompting the bank to implement 'performance plans' for those at risk.

title: 26 Nations Meet in Paris to Discuss Ukraine's Post-War Security Guarantees
snippets: Western leaders meet with Zelenskyy and US envoy at Ukraine summit in Paris as they draw up plans to deploy troops.
The "coalition of the willing," a group of European, NATO and non-NATO allies of Ukraine, met in Paris to finalize the details of security guarantees for Ukraine after the war. DW has the latest.
26 countries at Paris summit of ‘coalition of the willing’ committed to potential contributions after a ceasefire
titles: Ukraine allies push security guarantees amid US and Russian uncertainties
Ukraine updates: Allies meet in Paris over security plan
Macron says Trump to outline Ukraine security guarantees in days
summary: At a summit in Paris, leaders from 26 countries, including European, NATO, and non-NATO allies, met with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and a US envoy to discuss security guarantees for Ukraine post-war. They are part of the "coalition of the willing" and committed to potential contributions after a ceasefire is achieved.

title: Putin, Xi Discuss Immortality Through Organ Transplants in Leaked Chat
snippets: The presidents of China and Russia were overheard discussing transplants as a way to prolong life.
Medical advances and geopolitics collide for two septuagenarian leaders who have suggested that their time in office is far from over.
What do warmongers and strongmen chat about? Living forever, of course.
titles: Organ transplants for immortality: Might Xi and Putin be onto something?
In a ‘Hot Mic’ Moment, Xi and Putin Muse About Immortality and Organ Transplants
Putin: “Immortality” coming soon through continuous organ transplants
summary: During a Beijing military parade, a live broadcast captured a private conversation between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese Premier Xi Jinping, who have been in power for 25 and 13 years respectively. They speculated on the possibility of living forever through organ transplants, amidst discussions on medical advances and their prolonged tenures in office. This exchange highlights their interest in immortality and suggests their intention to remain in power indefinitely.

title: Epstein, Maxwell Abuse Survivors Demand Full File Release, Backed by Bipartisan
snippets: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell accusers demanded the full release of files relating to alleged sexual abuse. US President Donald Trump has faced consisten pressure to release them, even from his MAGA base.
In a rally in Washington, D.C., survivors detailed the abuse they said they suffered at the hands of Jeffrey Epstein, with some saying the abuse happened when they were teenagers.

A bipartisan group of House representatives spoke before introducing Jeffrey Epstein survivors on Capitol Hill on Wednesday as part of a push to have all files related to the accused sex trafficker released.

This is not a partisan issue. The American people – and Epstein’s many victims – deserve transparency

In 1986, my life went from black-and-white to color. It was the year I taped a Duran Duran poster to my rural Pennsylvania high school locker, and then months later hung out with band membe
titles: Jeffrey Epstein survivors: 'Release all files and secrecy'
WATCH:  Survivors of Jeffrey Epstein speak at rally
WATCH:  Bipartisan representatives hold news conference with Epstein survivors
I dated Jeffrey Epstein. The files must be released | Stacey Williams
summary: Accusers of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell have called for the release of all files related to their alleged sexual abuse. Survivors shared their experiences at a rally in Washington, D.C., and a bipartisan group of House representatives supported this demand on Capitol Hill, emphasizing the need for transparency and justice for Epstein's victims. The push for file disclosure has garnered attention from various groups, including President Trump's MAGA base.

title: French Women's Boxing Team Barred from Championships Over Late Tests
snippets: The French women's team will not compete at the World Boxing Championships in Liverpool because the results of their sexr tests were not delivered on time.
World Boxing will oversee Olympic regulation and has introduced mandatory genetic testing for female athletes above 18.

• French federation calls exclusion ‘a profound injustice’

  • World Boxing insists it warned all competitors of policy

French female boxers have been barred from competing at the inaugural World Boxing Championships in Liverpool after failing to meet a deadline f
titles: French women out of World Championships after missing gender test deadline
Boxing: All French females out of world championships over genetic test row
France’s female boxers are banned from world championships due to genetic sex test delay
summary: The French women's boxing team was excluded from the World Boxing Championships in Liverpool due to their genetic test results not being submitted on time. World Boxing, which now oversees Olympic boxing regulations, mandates genetic testing for female athletes over 18. The French federation labeled the exclusion as 'a profound injustice,' while World Boxing stated all competitors were warned about the policy.

title: U.S. Appeals to Supreme Court to Uphold Trump's Tariffs

titles: Trump administration files appeal to Supreme Court to keep tariffs in place - Axios
Trump asks US supreme court to overturn trade tariffs ruling
Trump urges Supreme Court to uphold his worldwide tariffs in a fast-track ruling
summary: The U.S. government has appealed to the Supreme Court to overturn a lower court's decision that deemed most of President Donald Trump's tariffs illegal, arguing they were an improper use of emergency powers. This move seeks to preserve the tariffs, challenging the prior ruling that Trump overstepped Congress' authority.

title: Kitchener Rangers, Guelph Storm Finalists for 2027 Memorial Cup Host
snippets: The Canadian Hockey League has named the Kitchener Rangers and Guelph Storm as finalists to host the 2027 Memorial Cup.
The Memorial Cup is coming back to Southwestern Ontario in 2027.
titles: Kitchener Rangers, Guelph Storm named finalists to host 2027 Memorial Cup.
Guelph Storm, Kitchener Rangers finalists to host 2027 Memorial Cup
summary: The Canadian Hockey League announced that the Kitchener Rangers and Guelph Storm are finalists to host the 2027 Memorial Cup, confirming the event will return to Southwestern Ontario that year.

title: Eagles Sought to Trade for Micah Parsons, Sources Say
snippets: The Eagles made a strong push to trade for Micah Parsons this summer, league sources told ESPN.
The Philadelphia Eagles made a push to keep Micah Parsons in the NFC East, according to a new report.

Report: Eagles called Cowboys about Parsons trade
summary: The Philadelphia Eagles made a strong push to trade for Micah Parsons this summer, aiming to keep him in the NFC East. The team's efforts were reported by league sources and indicate their interest in acquiring the player.

title: NFL's Goodell Hints at Taylor Swift for Super Bowl LX Halftime Show
snippets: The pop superstar, who is engaged to Travis Kelce, could serve as the headliner for the Super Bowl LX halftime show.
Appearing on the TODAY show Wednesday morning, NFL commissioner Roger Goodell addressed the possibility of pop star Taylor Swift performing the halftime show at Super Bowl LX.
titles: The Life of a (halftime) Showgirl? Roger Goodell says Taylor Swift a 'maybe' for Super Bowl LX
Goodell says Taylor Swift performing Super Bowl halftime show a ‘maybe’
summary: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell discussed the potential of Taylor Swift headlining the Super Bowl LX halftime show during an appearance on the TODAY show. Swift, who is engaged to Travis Kelce, is considered for the performance, though no final decision has been announced.

title: Google Launches Veo 3 for Photo-to-Video Conversion in Photos App
snippets: Google is adding Veo 3 software capabilities to its video generation feature for Google Photos. US-based users can turn static images into four-second videos by clicking either the "Subtle movements" or, for the more adventurous, the "I'm feeling lucky" options under the Create tab in Google Photos.
Google Photos' photo-to-video feature is being upgraded with Google's latest video-generation model, Veo 3.
titles: Google Photos now lets you animate your camera roll with Veo 3 for free
Google Photos upgrades its image-to-video feature with Veo 3
summary: Google has introduced Veo 3 software to its Google Photos service, enabling users in the US to convert static images into four-second videos. This feature is accessible through the "Subtle movements" and "I'm feeling lucky" options found under the Create tab. This upgrade represents an enhancement of Google Photos' photo-to-video capabilities.

title: Tech Giants Invited to White House Event, Elon Musk Excluded
snippets: Invitees include Meta founder Mark Zuckerberg, Apple CEO Tim Cook, Microsoft founder Bill Gates and OpenAI founder Sam Altman. Elon Musk was not on the list.
Elon Musk is not on the guest list released by the White House.

Trump Will Host Host Tech Billionaires Bill Gates, Tim Cook And Mark Zuckerberg At Rose Garden Event Tonight
summary: The White House released a guest list for an upcoming event that includes tech leaders such as Mark Zuckerberg, Tim Cook, Bill Gates, and Sam Altman. Elon Musk was notably absent from the list.

title: Atlassian Acquires The Browser Company for $610M Amid OpenAI Interest
snippets: OpenAI and Perplexity both reportedly looked at acquiring the startup.
Productivity software maker Atlassian has agreed to acquire The Browser Company, which makes the Arc and Dia browsers, for $610 million in cash.
titles: Atlassian agrees to acquire The Browser Co. for $610 million
Atlassian to buy Arc developer The Browser Company for $610M
summary: Atlassian, a productivity software maker, has confirmed the acquisition of The Browser Company, the creator of Arc and Dia browsers, for $610 million in cash. This purchase comes after both OpenAI and Perplexity reportedly showed interest in acquiring the startup.

title: Goldman Sachs, T. Rowe Price Partner for Private Market Access
snippets: Tie-up marks push to pitch private investments to everyday investors
Goldman Sachs and T. Rowe Price are teaming up to offering wealth and retirement clients more investment options from the world of private markets.
titles: Goldman to buy $1bn stake in T Rowe Price
Goldman Sachs buys $1 billion stake in T. Rowe Price as more banks start offering private-market investments to individuals
summary: Goldman Sachs and T. Rowe Price have formed a partnership to provide wealth and retirement clients with expanded investment opportunities in private markets. This collaboration aims to make private investments more accessible to everyday investors.

title: Analysts: President's Critique May Weaken Dollar, Bolster Gold Value
snippets: President’s attack on US central bank will erode dollar’s reserve status and extend precious metal’s rally, say analysts
“Gold is a store of value that doesn’t rely on institutional trust,” Samantha Dart says.
titles: Gold could hit nearly $5,000 if Trump undermines Fed, says Goldman Sachs
The price of gold could hit $5,000 if Trump keeps meddling with the Fed, Goldman Sachs says
summary: Analysts predict that the President's criticism of the US central bank will undermine the dollar's status as a reserve currency and boost the value of gold. They argue gold's value comes from its independence from institutional trust, as highlighted by analyst Samantha Dart.

title: American Eagle Sees Surge in Sales, Credits Sweeney and Kelce Campaigns
snippets: American Eagle said its Sydney Sweeney campaign is its best ever, leading to positive gains in new customers, sales and foot traffic.
The retailer said ads starring Sweeney, praised by President Donald Trump amid broader controversy, are “not going anywhere.”
titles: American Eagle stock soars 20% as retailer says Sydney Sweeney campaign is 'best' to date, beats earnings
American Eagle Shares Surge 30% After Sydney Sweeney Ad
summary: American Eagle reported significant positive impacts from its promotional campaigns featuring Sydney Sweeney and Travis Kelce, including an increase in new customers, sales, and foot traffic. The company's stock surged following the announcement of better-than-expected same-store sales forecasts, attributed to the successful marketing efforts.

title: Google Ordered to Pay $425M for Privacy Breach in California
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiigFBVV95cUxQS0hrYnRxeWZMd3U4cm11d21lVDU3NFYxUjdldlNEMG11LXRDRTBYRW84YWF4YnVhUEZfa0RUR1Y2bm93bnBTRGZaUDFocC1xZEpBbnQ0b19kaG44T2NtM05TTUhzNnBTWWNoYlNFTHA5MmZRZXhKcm1la2NYVmRvQzNTay1rTVpJQXc?oc=5" target="_blank">Google must pay $425 million in privacy

A federal jury in California has ordered Google to pay $425 million for violating user privacy by collecting the data of millions of people even after they disabled tracking, as reported earlier by Reuters. The decision stems from a class action lawsuit filed in July 2020, which accused Google of un
titles: Google must pay $425 million in privacy lawsuit, jury says - Axios
Jury orders Google to pay $425 million for violating user privacy
summary: A federal jury in California ruled that Google must pay $425 million for infringing on user privacy. This verdict is a result of a class action lawsuit from July 2020, which claimed Google collected data from millions of users even after they had disabled tracking.

title: Google Unveils New Updates for Android and Pixel Devices
snippets: Google announced on Wednesday that it's bringing a slew of new features to the Android ecosystem and Pixel devices.
Google's latest updates include a smattering of features for Pixels and other Android phones.
